name: Role
description: The Role segment (ROL) contains information about the functional roles played by the person identified in the previous segments. This segment is used across multiple message types to define provider roles and relationships, essential for care team coordination and accountability. The ROL segment can specify attending physicians, consulting physicians, referring physicians, primary care providers, nurses, and other healthcare team members. It provides critical information for understanding care relationships, billing responsibilities, and communication pathways within healthcare workflows.

cardinality.note: Multiple ROL segments can be used for different roles and relationships

ROL.1.name: Role Instance ID
ROL.1.description: This field contains a unique identifier for this instance of the role relationship. This allows for tracking and updating specific role assignments.
ROL.1.generationHint: System-generated unique ID for role tracking: ROL<timestamp><sequence>

ROL.2.name: Action Code
ROL.2.description: This field indicates what action is being taken with respect to this role (add, delete, update, no change).
ROL.2.generationHint: AD for new role assignments, UP for role changes, UC for existing roles

ROL.3.name: Role - ROL
ROL.3.description: This field contains the functional role that the person specified in ROL.4 plays with respect to the patient.
ROL.3.generationHint: AT (attending) most common in hospital, PP (primary care) in ambulatory settings

ROL.4.name: Role Person
ROL.4.description: This field contains identification and demographic information about the person who fulfills this role.
ROL.4.generationHint: Provider name with ID, title, and credentials: ID^Last^First^Middle^Suffix^Prefix^Degree

ROL.5.name: Role Begin Date/Time
ROL.5.description: This field contains the date and time when this role assignment began.
ROL.5.generationHint: When role assignment started - admission time for attending, referral time for consultants

ROL.6.name: Role End Date/Time
ROL.6.description: This field contains the date and time when this role assignment ended or is expected to end.
ROL.6.generationHint: When role assignment ended - discharge time, transfer time, or consultation completion

ROL.7.name: Role Duration
ROL.7.description: This field contains the expected duration of the role assignment.
ROL.7.generationHint: EPIS for hospital stay roles, ONGO for primary care relationships

ROL.8.name: Role Action Reason
ROL.8.description: This field contains the reason for the role action specified in ROL.2.
ROL.8.generationHint: ADMIT for new admissions, CONSULT for specialist referrals, COVER for call coverage

ROL.9.name: Provider Type
ROL.9.description: This field further categorizes the type of provider fulfilling this role.
ROL.9.generationHint: PHYS for physicians, NURS for nursing roles, PHARM for pharmacy consultations

ROL.10.name: Organization Unit Type
ROL.10.description: This field identifies the type of organizational unit where this role is being performed.
ROL.10.generationHint: DEPT for departmental assignments, WARD for nursing units, ICU for critical care

ROL.11.name: Address
ROL.11.description: This field contains the address information for the person in the role.
ROL.11.generationHint: Professional address where the role performer can be contacted

ROL.12.name: Phone
ROL.12.description: This field contains the phone number(s) for the person in the role.
ROL.12.generationHint: Professional phone numbers including office, pager, mobile, and fax

epic.notes: Epic provides comprehensive role management with care team coordination and messaging workflows

cerner.notes: Cerner emphasizes provider credentialing and hierarchical role relationships

allscripts.notes: Allscripts provides essential role management for practice workflow coordination

nextgen.notes: NextGen focuses on practice-based role management and provider communication

notes: ROL segment defines provider roles and relationships critical for care coordination
Action Code (ROL.2), Role (ROL.3), and Role Person (ROL.4) are required fields
Multiple ROL segments can describe different roles for the same provider or different providers
Role begin/end dates help track temporary assignments and care transitions
Provider type and organization unit provide additional context for role assignments
Contact information supports care team communication and coordination

dataConsistency.actionCodeLogic: Action code should align with role assignment context (AD for new, UP for changes)
dataConsistency.roleProviderAlignment: Role should match provider type and credentials
dataConsistency.dateSequencing: Begin date should precede end date when both are present
dataConsistency.contactInformation: Address and phone should be professional/work-related

businessRules.roleHierarchy: Attending physicians have primary responsibility, consulting providers are secondary
businessRules.credentialValidation: Provider credentials should match their assigned roles
businessRules.coverageRequirements: Critical roles should have coverage assignments during off-hours
businessRules.communicationPaths: Role assignments should include appropriate contact information
businessRules.temporalLogic: Role durations should align with episode of care or ongoing relationships

messageFlow.workflow: Essential for care coordination, billing, communication, and provider accountability
